greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of tilings of a k X n rectangle using polyominoes of shape I; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: A polyomino of shape I is a rectangle of width 1.

All columns (or rows) are linear recurrences with constant coefficients. An upper bound on the order of the recurrence is A005683(k+2). This upper bound is exact for at least 1 <= k <= 10. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 23 2019
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..495
program: T(n,k)={if(k<2, if(k==0||n==0, 1, 2^(n-1)), my(S=mkS(k), v=vector(#S, i, i==1)); for(n=1, n, v=step(v,S)); vecsum(v))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 23 2019
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 30 2015
